over the last few years staff has

citations staff estimates that it was

first attempt in nearly a third of the
citations issued over the last year
pursuant to rule 7b of the commission's
rules of practice and procedure which
has caused delays in hearings of up to
six months rule 7 provides various
processes by which service of commission
proceedings can be made and while
publication in the commission's official
bulletin is considered proper service
the commission and the administrative
hearings division has historically taken
the approach that the transportation
citation should be served via rule 7b
which requires service by certified or
registered mail this process is where
staff has experienced an increase in
service issues historically the
commission through its administrative
hearings division has accepted service
via certified mail as proof of service
when the citation is issued to the
carrier's address on file with the
commission and either the green card
receipt is returned to the commission
the green card receipt is not returned
but the usps post office certified
tracking website indicates that the
citation was delivered or the citation
was not claimed by the carrier if the
citation is to an unregistered carrier
the same process applies except that
staff uses the address of the registered
agent of the company as recorded with
the louisiana secretary of state delays
have occurred in processing violations
due to staff not receiving the returned
green card receipt and the united states
post office certified mail tracking
website indefinitely indicating that the
items were awaiting delivery scan or
in-route to next facility staff reached
out to the united states post office and
staff's understanding is that the post
office's website can reflect these
descriptions for a number of reasons
such as the certified item not being
scanned by the mail carrier the green
card receipt being left on the attached
citation envelope or simply that the
green card was lost and route back to
the commission
when staff does not receive the green
card back and the united states postal
service website tracking does not
indicate receipt or unclaimed status
staff is required to request the hearing
be continued to another date and start
the proof of service process over again
which causes undue delay in proceedings
to the hearings an attempt to avoid
undue delays for transportation citation
hearings and continued duplicative use
of resources staff is recommending
modification to the rule that one
clarifies when the bulletin is
considered proper service and two allows
for other means of service where proof
of delivery attempted delivery with
refusal or unclaimed delivery can be
shown and making this recommendation
staff is not attempting to circumvent
proper service for citations but is
recommending alternative delivery
options staff recommends it is
recognized as it still has the burden of
proof that proper service was made when

further staff acknowledges formal

staff is of the opinion that an interim

in order to clarify streamline or
correct other components of the
